alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 9:45PM PST until January 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 15 inches and ice accumulations of around one half of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From 1 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds with falling snow may reduce visibility at times. The combination of ice and snow may make travel difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
